en: Dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire

description.zh-cn: 指1806年8月6日，最后一任神圣罗马皇帝弗朗茨二世宣布放弃帝号，解散帝国的历史事件。此事件标志着自查理曼加冕以来拉丁-罗马帝国法统的中断。在德意志地区，该事件被广泛比作古代的特洛伊城陷落。
description.en: The historical event on August 6, 1806, when the last Holy Roman Emperor, Francis II, abdicated his title and dissolved the empire. This event marked the end of the legal tradition of the Latin-Roman Empire that had existed since the coronation of Charlemagne. In the German-speaking lands, the dissolution was widely compared to the ancient Fall of Troy.

nodes.id: 弗朗茨二世 (神圣罗马帝国)

zh-cn: 弗朗茨二世 (神圣罗马帝国)

description.zh-cn: 哈布斯堡-洛林王朝的成员，是最后一位神圣罗马皇帝。为应对拿破仑称帝，他创立奥地利皇位并成为首任奥地利皇帝（称弗朗茨一世）。在奥斯特里茨战役战败后，他于1806年8月6日宣布解散神圣罗马帝国。
description.en: A member of the House of Habsburg-Lorraine and the last Holy Roman Emperor. In response to Napoleon crowning himself emperor, he founded the Austrian imperial title and became the first Emperor of Austria (as Francis I). After the defeat at the Battle of Austerlitz, he announced the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire on August 6, 1806.

description.zh-cn: 一个自欧洲中世纪延续至19世纪初的政治实体，其皇帝被视为古罗马帝国的合法继承者和西方基督教世界的世俗领袖。在经历了三十年战争和拿破仑战争的削弱后，于1806年解体。
description.en: A political entity in Europe that lasted from the Middle Ages to the early 19th century. Its emperors were considered the legitimate successors to the ancient Roman Empire and the secular leaders of Western Christendom. It was dissolved in 1806 after being weakened by the Thirty Years' War and the Napoleonic Wars.

description.zh-cn: 法兰西第一帝国皇帝，通过拿破仑战争极大地改变了欧洲政治格局，其军事和政治行动直接导致了神圣罗马帝国的解体。
description.en: Emperor of the First French Empire, who significantly altered the political landscape of Europe through the Napoleonic Wars. His military and political actions directly led to the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire.

description.zh-cn: 由德意志邦国组成的邦联，是法兰西第一帝国的卫星国。其成立是神圣罗马帝国解体的直接原因之一。
description.en: A confederation of German states that served as a satellite state of the First French Empire. Its formation was one of the direct causes of the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire.

description.zh-cn: 在神圣罗马帝国解体后，于1815年在其原主要地区建立的邦联。
description.en: A confederation established in 1815 in the former main territory of the Holy Roman Empire after its dissolution.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲的王室王朝，其君主在神圣罗马帝国解体后继续担任奥地利皇帝和匈牙利国王。
description.en: A European royal dynasty whose monarchs continued to serve as Emperor of Austria and King of Hungary after the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire.

description.zh-cn: 一场主要在德意志地区进行的欧洲战争，对当地经济和人口造成巨大破坏，削弱了哈布斯堡家族的实力，是神圣罗马帝国衰落的开端。
description.en: A European war fought primarily in the German lands, which caused immense economic and demographic devastation, weakened the power of the House of Habsburg, and marked the beginning of the decline of the Holy Roman Empire.

description.zh-cn: 由拿破仑统治下的法国及其盟国与其他欧洲国家之间的一系列战争，最终导致了神圣罗马帝国的崩溃。
description.en: A series of wars between France under Napoleon and its allies against other European nations, which ultimately led to the collapse of the Holy Roman Empire.

description.zh-cn: 在拿破仑战争之前的一系列欧洲冲突，神圣罗马帝国卷入其中，开始了其最终的衰落。
description.en: A series of European conflicts preceding the Napoleonic Wars, in which the Holy Roman Empire became involved, beginning its final decline.

description.zh-cn: 拿破仑战争中的一场决定性战役，奥地利的惨败导致第三次反法同盟瓦解，并加速了神圣罗马帝国的解体。
description.en: A decisive battle in the Napoleonic Wars where Austria's catastrophic defeat led to the collapse of the Third Coalition and accelerated the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire.

description.zh-cn: 由欧洲国家组成的反对拿破仑法国的军事同盟，在奥斯特里茨战役失败后瓦解。
description.en: A military alliance of European nations against Napoleonic France, which collapsed after the defeat at the Battle of Austerlitz.

description.zh-cn: 拿破仑于1804年为自己创立的帝号。
description.en: The imperial title created by Napoleon for himself in 1804.

description.zh-cn: 由神圣罗马皇帝弗朗茨二世于1804年创立的世袭帝号，作为对拿破仑称帝的回应。
description.en: A hereditary imperial title created in 1804 by Holy Roman Emperor Francis II in response to Napoleon's coronation.

description.zh-cn: 指19世纪关于如何实现德意志统一的政治辩论，此问题在神圣罗马帝国解体后产生。
description.en: Refers to the 19th-century political debate over how to achieve German unification, an issue that arose after the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire.

description.zh-cn: 旨在将德意志各邦国统一为一个民族国家的政治运动，最终导致了德意志帝国的成立。
description.en: A political movement aimed at unifying the German states into a single nation-state, which ultimately led to the establishment of the German Empire.

description.zh-cn: 标志着德意志统一完成和德意志帝国建立的事件。
description.en: The event that marked the completion of German unification and the establishment of the German Empire.

description.zh-cn: 神圣罗马帝国的统治者头衔。
description.en: The title of the ruler of the Holy Roman Empire.

relationships.source: 弗朗茨二世 (神圣罗马帝国)

description.zh-cn: 弗朗茨二世公开宣布放弃其皇帝头衔，并解散帝国，直接导致了神圣罗马帝国解体。
description.en: Francis II publicly abdicated his imperial title and dissolved the empire, directly causing its dissolution.

description.zh-cn: 神圣罗马帝国解体事件标志着神圣罗马帝国的终结。
description.en: The dissolution event marked the end of the Holy Roman Empire.

description.zh-cn: 大量德意志附庸脱离神圣罗马帝国并组成莱茵邦联，这意味着事实上帝国的终结。
description.en: A large number of German vassals seceded from the Holy Roman Empire to form the Confederation of the Rhine, which meant the de facto end of the empire.

description.zh-cn: 拿破仑的军事胜利和政治操作（如建立莱茵邦联）是导致弗朗茨二世解散神圣罗马帝国的直接原因。
description.en: Napoleon's military victories and political maneuvers (such as creating the Confederation of the Rhine) were the direct causes that led Francis II to dissolve the Holy Roman Empire.

description.zh-cn: 拿破仑促使德意志邦国组成法国的卫星国莱茵邦联。
description.en: Napoleon pushed the German states to form the Confederation of the Rhine as a satellite state of France.

description.zh-cn: 莱茵邦联是法国（拿破仑）的卫星国。
description.en: The Confederation of the Rhine was a satellite state of France (Napoleon).

description.zh-cn: 三十年战争对德意志地区经济和人口造成摧残，割裂了帝国，是帝国衰落的开始。
description.en: The Thirty Years' War devastated the economy and population of the German lands, fractured the empire, and marked the beginning of its decline.

description.zh-cn: 神圣罗马帝国卷入拿破仑战争后，开始了真正的衰落并最终解体。
description.en: After getting involved in the Napoleonic Wars, the Holy Roman Empire began its true decline and eventual dissolution.

description.zh-cn: 神圣罗马帝国卷入法国大革命战争后，开始了真正的衰落。
description.en: After getting involved in the French Revolutionary Wars, the Holy Roman Empire began its true decline.

description.zh-cn: 奥斯特里茨战役的失败导致第三次反法同盟瓦解。
description.en: The defeat at the Battle of Austerlitz led to the collapse of the Third Coalition.

relationships.target: 弗朗茨二世 (神圣罗马帝国)

description.zh-cn: 弗朗茨二世统治下的奥地利在奥斯特里茨战役中战败，这是导致他最终解散帝国的关键事件。
description.en: Austria under Francis II was defeated at the Battle of Austerlitz, a key event that led him to eventually dissolve the empire.

relationships.target: 弗朗茨二世 (神圣罗马帝国)

description.zh-cn: 拿破仑在1804年称帝，与神圣罗马皇帝弗朗茨二世对立，并在战争中击败后者，最终迫使其解散帝国。
description.en: Napoleon crowned himself emperor in 1804, opposing Holy Roman Emperor Francis II, defeated him in war, and ultimately forced him to dissolve the empire.

relationships.source: 弗朗茨二世 (神圣罗马帝国)
弗朗茨二世 (神圣罗马帝国)

description.zh-cn: 他是最后一位神圣罗马皇帝。
description.en: He was the last Holy Roman Emperor.

relationships.source: 弗朗茨二世 (神圣罗马帝国)

description.zh-cn: 作为对拿破仑称帝的回应，弗朗茨二世宣布自己为奥地利皇帝弗朗茨一世。
description.en: In response to Napoleon's coronation, Francis II declared himself Francis I, Emperor of Austria.

description.zh-cn: 神圣罗马帝国解体后，在其原地区于1815年建立了德意志邦联作为后继者之一。
description.en: After the dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire, the German Confederation was established in 1815 in its former territory as one of its successors.

description.zh-cn: 神圣罗马帝国的解体产生了“德国问题”，即关于德意志统一可能性的探讨。
description.en: The dissolution of the Holy Roman Empire gave rise to the 'German Question', a debate about the possibilities of German unification.

description.zh-cn: 对“德国问题”的探讨推动了德意志统一运动。
description.en: The debate on the 'German Question' spurred the movement for German unification.

description.zh-cn: 德意志统一运动最终导致了德意志帝国的宣告成立。
description.en: The movement for German unification ultimately led to the proclamation of the German Empire.
